01.text: Went to Confession for First Friday. Wne to meeting of R.C.H.J.A. at Glenn Fisher's house. Mrs. Peele told us the story of the R.C. Hospital. Very interesting.

02.text: Went to Mass & Communion for First Friday. Went to Y's Men's Ice Frolic. Mr Lewis played badminton on ice. Saw boy that looks exactly like Bob Garris. "Corny Cornfield's" ballad awful.

03.text: Went to Choir. Fran and mary Turnbull were there. Swept and cleaned basement with Dad. Jo going to Spinster's Ball with Don Fraser.

04.text: Went to skating. Had lesson Mr Corder very nice learned eight three and spread eagle Tried to teach us waltz Had bath and washed hair.

05.text: Had gym. Learning two crazy dances that look like Indian [loar?] dances. Went to skating club. Rook belly flop during Grand March. Both knees were bumped.

06.text: Went to Carnival practice in Arenel Missed Guides as I was too tired and Gram was sick. Went to Mr. Ward's orchestra. It's just perfect

07.text: Had singing. Learned a lot of Irish songs for St Pat.'s day concert. Went to music lesson. Miss Rutherford got swell new coat.

08.text: Went down town after school and bought swell new suitcase. Practised three-part songs for concert. Varnished suitcase to make it water-proof.

09.text: Went to skating club but only for an hour as hockey match on. We were allowed in free so stayed. Had swell fun and learned lots of new jokes

10.text: Went to Vancouver with Noreen. Stayed for lunch at her house for dinner then joined whole group of kids and went to see "The Hunchback of Norte Dame".

11.text: The governor-general Lord [Teverdsmuir] died at 7:13 P.M. tonight after a fall he received last Tuesday. Went to skating club.

12.text: Went to skating club. Practised for Carnival from 4:00 to 6:00 P.M. Everyone was frozen when we got through. No gym today

13.text: Went to Guides. New girl called Joiyce Brown there She's swell Went to Mr. Ward's orchestra Dad went away to Kelowna for a day on some business.

14.text: Had half holiday because of Lord Tweedsmuir's funeral. No homework. Went to see "Four Wives" with the Lane Sisters & Gale Paige Eddit Albert takes part of doctor. He's grand.

15.text: Went to meeting of RCHJA at Joyce Furness' house. Jean had operation Fround stone in her stomache. Joe to take exam tomorrow in music.

16.text: Got out at noon & came down to Grandpa's house. Dad had awful trouble with his car. Saw moving pictures of Pope's coronation at school.

17.text: Went down and saw The Fighting 69th with Jimmy Cogney and Pat O'Brien. June came over with little Joe who has grown an awful lot.

18.text: Went to 9:30 Mass with Grandpa. Mary merritt came over for dinner. Saw Paul's boat. It's swell. came up to June's house to stay overnight Paula wants all the attention

19.text: Stayed in bed until 9:30 7 had nap in afternoon from 1 to 4 P.M. Thought of kids wakling hard in school. Saw Fritz Kriesler. He was marvellous! Went to Smalley's for milkshake after.

20.text: Left Bellingham at 9:00 A.M. and didn't get to school until 10:00 AM. Went to Guides. did a lot of signaling Went to Mr. Ward's orchestra. We sounded squeaky after hearing Kriesler

21.text: Went to music lesson. Botty Conn worse than Ever. Went to Miss Gilley's Studio Club. All kids played pieces and we sang.

22.text: Grandpa & Grandma came up. Fifi, Gretchen Nancy Mary Ida and Bill dropped in on way back to Seattle. Went out and sang at concert. It was corniest concert I've ever beed to.

23.text: Had brute of a Social Studies test. Went to skating club. It was so cold outside it made the rink twice as cold and everyone froze.

24.text: Went downtown with Gerry and marion Nixon and saw Sonja Henie in "It Happened One Night" Skating good but picture rotten Went to Mrs. Thompson's for music meeting

25.text: Helen Sam and Shaun came over for dinner Went to skating club. Wrote thank-you note to June.

26.text: Went to gym. Left at 3:30 to go to skating to practise for Carnival. It's tiring but it looks swell. Went to see Jeannie. She looks much better. Has more colour in cheeks

27.text: Went to Guides. Planning display for March 15. Went to Mr. Ward's orchestra. Sister M. Pat sprung Latin test on us without a word of warning.
